meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound
meanings.sent1: The old door crakes when it is opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate crakes loudly when pushed.
meanings.sent3: The crakes of the chair made everyone in the room chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His voice crakes with emotion as he tries to speak.
meanings.sent5: The crakes of the car engine were a sign of trouble ahead.

meanings.definition: A type of bird in the rail family
meanings.sent1: We spotted a few crakes near the pond during our nature walk.
meanings.sent2: The crakes have beautiful plumage and are excellent swimmers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to catch the crakes but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The crakes chirped melodiously in the early morning light.
meanings.sent5: The crakes' nest was hidden among the reeds by the riverbank.

meanings.sent1: The crakes of the old floorboards echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent2: The crakes of the ice under their feet made them cautious while skating.
meanings.sent3: The crakes of the tree branches in the wind sounded like a spooky melody.
meanings.sent4: The crakes of the wooden ship signaled its age and history.
meanings.sent5: The crakes of the thunder in the distance foretold an approaching storm.
